stream_context.summary: Kaze finishes a final polish pass on Course 1 (Bunny Brush Woods) and moves development focus to Course 14, a large cardboard-and-craft themed stage.  The stream is spent (1) testing new HUD fonts, animations and performance on real hardware, (2) debating texture/art fixes, and (3) redesigning a star mission—scrapping a rigid paper-airplane silver-star idea in favour of a Wing-Cap, free-flight challenge that uses new ‘bubble-blower’ paper targets.  Live on-stream Kaze models a graph-paper airplane and plans asset tasks with the art team.

development_findings.summary: Course 1 is now considered "done" after a texture/bridge pass; HUD font upgraded with higher-resolution, semi-transparent characters supplied by Biobak.
development_findings.quote: "Either way, today actually we're done with course one."

development_findings.summary: Original Course 14 mission ‘Paper airplane collecting five silver stars in a circle’ is being replaced by a Wing-Cap challenge available only in Act 5/6 to amplify player freedom.
development_findings.quote: "The whole level suddenly opens up because you have the Wing Cap; I think I much prefer that over the Paper Airplane."

development_findings.summary: Design for the new Wing-Cap star: ground-pound ‘X’ marks or timed switches placed at landmarks only reachable (or fastest) with Wing-Cap; cannons positioned to regain momentum.
Need two new assets: (a) bubble-blower style paper target rings that rip when flown through, and (b) a folded graph-paper airplane.  Kaze models the airplane live; Biobak/Lera will handle targets.
development_findings.quote: "We just need the targets now and the paper plane… then this mission can be programmed."

development_findings.summary: Course 14 contains five area-dependent music tracks; Badub has already composed and uploaded them to SoundCloud, and instruments cross-fade as the player moves.

Performance: current build runs ~50 FPS on real N64 hardware despite overdraw; large props (mountains, floor) will be culled and Biobak’s upcoming art pass usually improves both visuals and framerate.
Camera auto-rotate bug while flying: auto-rotate toggles off unexpectedly; Kaze flags this for later debugging.
Technical tweak: new grind animation implemented; Zeina will create a proper HUD icon to replace the temporary placeholder.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy: post-tutorial stages exist mainly to deliver ‘freedom and immersion’; contrast between constrained and free moments heightens the feeling of freedom.
context_findings.quote: "Contrast is really what amplifies your feeling… freedom is going to feel more freedom."

context_findings.summary: Self-assessment: Kaze rates himself a ‘10/10 programmer’ but only ‘7/10 designer’, acknowledging room for design feedback.
View on re-works: Prefers revisiting levels rather than shipping weaker content—"Would you rather just have the worst level?"
Legal bravado: jokes that Nintendo should fear him more than he fears takedowns.
context_findings.quote: "Nintendo should be scared I attack headquarters."

context_findings.summary: Personal notes: mentions a young child, thunderstorms causing power outage in prior stream, and learning French phrases from a toy.

biobak.summary: Created the new high-resolution HUD font textures and will optimise Course 14 artwork & performance.
Volunteered to model the bubble-blower target or other props for the Wing-Cap mission.

badub.summary: Delivered multiple adaptive music tracks for Course 14; three are already public on SoundCloud.

zeina.summary: Tasked with producing a proper HUD icon for the new grind animation.

key_stories.title: Wing Cap Liberation
key_stories.summary: Kaze discards a stiff paper-airplane silver-star mission and devises a new Act 6 Wing-Cap challenge that lets players fly freely across Course 14.
key_stories.challenge: Original design felt purposeless and constrained.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed live: spawn Wing-Cap only in later acts, use cannons for momentum, replace silver stars with ground-pound spots or timed switches.
key_stories.outcome: Team commits to new concept; asset list (targets, cap boxes) and placement plan drafted.
key_stories.key_quote: The whole level suddenly opens up because you have the Wing Cap; I think I much prefer that over the Paper Airplane.

key_stories.title: Sharper Letters
key_stories.summary: The HUD was hard to read; Biobak supplied smoother fonts and Kaze updated the engine to handle semi-transparent characters.
key_stories.challenge: Original pixelated HUD clashed with upgraded visuals.
key_stories.process: Biobak produced textures; Kaze added RGB/alpha support and tested on CRT.
key_stories.key_quote: If you look closely at the font, you'll see that it is now much less pixelated.

key_stories.title: The Unfitting Bridge
key_stories.summary: A wooden bridge texture in Course 1 looked out of place.
key_stories.process: Chat feedback; Kaze experimented with gradients and color lerps using N64 combiner; still searching for compromise texture.
key_stories.outcome: Bridge marked for re-texturing; work ongoing.
key_stories.key_quote: The bridge is unfitting; it doesn't fit in the world that it's in.
